title: Pork Steaks With Apple Sauce & Cheese
description: You'll bash these pork steaks flat, a technique known as 'escaloping'. You'll learn how to make a homemade apple sauce, (which is ever so easy) before piling the sauce and cheese over the steaks so that they melt in the oven. Served with crispy potatoes and mustard green beans. Sorry for being a bit cheesy, but this dish is the apple of our eye!

cooking_instructions.instruction:
Preheat the oven to 220°C/ 200°C (fan)/ 425°F/ Gas 7

Cut the potatoes (skins on) into bite-size pieces 

Add them to a baking tray, drizzle with 1-2 tbsp vegetable oil & season with salt

Put them in the oven for 25 min or until golden & crisp

Meanwhile, peel the apple[s]

Cut them into rough pieces, discarding the core[s]

Add the apple to a pot (with a matching lid) with 50ml (100ml) cold water

Bring to the boil over a medium heat

Cover with a lid and cook for 10-15 min until the apple is softened

Once softened, remove from the heat and mash them thoroughly with a potato masher - this is your apple sauce

Place the pork steaks close together on a clean chopping board and cover with a sheet of greaseproof paper or cling film

Using a rolling pin (or another heavy implement) bash the steaks so that are 0.5cm thick

Rub the steaks either side with 1 tsp [2 tsp] vegetable oil and season with salt

Heat a large pan (preferably non-stick) over a high heat

Once hot, add the pork steaks and cook on each side for 1 min

Transfer the steaks to a plate and set aside 

Meanwhile, boil a kettle

Trim the ends off the green beans

Add them to a pot of boiling water with a pinch of salt and bring to the boil over a high heat

Cook for 7 min or until tender

Once cooked, drain and return the beans to the cooking pot, drizzle with a little olive oil and stir through the wholegrain mustard

Add the pork steaks to a baking tray (use tin foil to avoid mess!)

Divide the apple sauce between them and spread it evenly over

Top each steak with a piece of cheddar

Put them in the oven for 5 min or until the cheddar has just melted but not coloured

Serve the melted cheesy steaks with the roast potatoes and green beans 

Enjoy!
